p: Humoral immune response was measured using hemagglutination inhibition test (HAI), microneutralization assay (MN), serum IgA and serum IgG. On day 21, 14 of 100 (14%) of participants in the vaccine group had a fourfold or greater rise of antibodies by at least one of HAI, MN, IgA or IaG assays. On days 49 and 60, 36 (36%) and 53 (53%) out of 100 vaccinees, respectively, showed a 4-fold or greater increase of antibodies with at least one of these four assays, while no 4-fold or greater rise was observed in the placebo group on any days.
